text:
@thecatfix @jdorfman @Steve_Yegge @Sourcegraph @AmpCode This is helpful, thank you! We have gotten a ton of feedback saying we need more 'easily consumed' content. So tough to make everyone happy, but I think you make some good points about how we can make our content more navigable. 

Will make some changes. Thank you!
fullText:
@thecatfix @jdorfman @Steve_Yegge @Sourcegraph @AmpCode This is helpful, thank you! We have gotten a ton of feedback saying we need more 'easily consumed' content. So tough to make everyone happy, but I think you make some good points about how we can make our content more navigable. 

Will make some changes. Thank you!

text: @krzyzanowskim @AmpCode We recommend you use small threads (https://t.co/p3tUM9x3r4) and create a new thread per task. Longer threads are more expensive and requests with more than 200k tokens are roughly twice as expensive per token in Anthropic's API pricing.
fullText: @krzyzanowskim @AmpCode We recommend you use small threads (https://t.co/p3tUM9x3r4) and create a new thread per task. Longer threads are more expensive and requests with more than 200k tokens are roughly twice as expensive per token in Anthropic's API pricing.

@ampcode when you compact? which I don't usually do but I did tonight, it's not saving the most recent work but seems to be deleting it back to a midway point in the thread.  Shouldn't compact preserve the most recent and focus on earlier responses to delete?  I just seems a little odd that it has no ideas what we just did.  
I don't like posting this in public, is there a way to report these type findings?

quote.text:
Wellakshually.... You cooould argue that the model is the meat, right, the main thing, the... well, the meat of the matter.

But the prompts, the tooling, the whole scaffolding around it, that's the sauce, isn't it?

Good meat can make up for bad sauce, but good sauce? oof man.

text:
Thank you to the 20,000 folks that joined us live for the GPT-5 announcement!

FYI, if you want to try GPT-5 in @AmpCode on the CLI, just do this:

pnpm add -g @sourcegraph/amp
# or
yarn global add @sourcegraph/amp
# or
npm install -g @sourcegraph/amp

# run it 
amp --try-gpt5
fullText:
Thank you to the 20,000 folks that joined us live for the GPT-5 announcement!

FYI, if you want to try GPT-5 in @AmpCode on the CLI, just do this:

pnpm add -g @sourcegraph/amp
# or
yarn global add @sourcegraph/amp
# or
npm install -g @sourcegraph/amp

# run it 
amp --try-gpt5

text:
If you've never built an agent and are looking for a fun, effortless, interactive way to make one, paste this into your terminal:

echo 'build me a simple agent using https://t.co/Foyv86ey5h' | npx @sourcegraph/amp

Then have the agent you just created explain how it works. https://t.co/s9MPkshtIe
